H0.text: Who in 1845, wrote the poem 'The Pied Piper of Hamlin'. Edgar Allan Poe

H1.text: Who in 1845, wrote the poem 'The Pied Piper of Hamlin'. Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

H2.text: Who in 1845, wrote the poem 'The Pied Piper of Hamlin'. John Keats

H3.text: Who in 1845, wrote the poem 'The Pied Piper of Hamlin'. ROBERTBROWNING

A4.text: Robert Browning is now popularly known for such poems as Porphyria's Lover, My Last Duchess, How They Brought the Good News from Ghent to Aix, and The Pied Piper of Hamelin.

A5.text: The Pied Piper of Hamelin appears in III: Dramatic Lyrics (1842).

A6.text: Robert Browning wrote a poem called 'The Pied Piper of Hamelin' using the 1605 Verstegan version of the tale.

A7.text: The poem was published in Browning's Dramatic Lyrics (1842).

A8.text: An 1888 illustrated version of Robert Browning's poem (Illustrated by Kate Greenaway)
